notes: The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on June 1 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. According to government sources, as of 6 pm of June 1 the ongoing military operations left at least 175 people dead - 120 militants, 36 government security forces and 19 civilians. (35 fatalities have been recorded for June 1 but it is unclear when they occurred.)

Non-violent activity: A member of the paramilitary group Alamara forcefully entered the Salugpongan Ta Tanu Igkanogon Community Learning Centre in Sitio Nasilaban, Talaingod area, Davao del Norte on June 1 and harassed the teacher-in charge, suspecting him to be a rebel sympathizer.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead by motorcycle-riding men at Samonte town, Isabela at around 8 am on June 1.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a raid (assumed police) in Barangay Tarcan, Baliwag town in Bulacan on June 1.
A drug suspect who is connected to a high-value target was killed during a police raid at Toledo, Cebu on 01 Jun 2017.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a raid (assumed police) in Barangay Bayugo, Meycauayan city in Bulacan on June 2.

About 20 armed men wearing Army uniform, who had stormed the detachment of the 42nd Infantry Battalion in Sirawai, Zamboanga del Norte town on May 30, took 3 civilian hostages from Barangay Riconalla in Siocon town area on June 2 as they continued to withdraw amid a military pursuit operation. One of the hostages was shot dead shortly after being taken. The two other hostages had been successfully rescued by government forces also on June 2. The armed men were led by a certain Jamilun Wahab but it was the group's affiliation was unclear.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on June 2 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. The Philippine military on Friday, admitted losing two armored vehicles to local armed groups in Marawi City. (No new fatalities have been reported for June 2.)

Various groups, led by Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan), held a Black Friday protest on June 2 in Quezon City, Manila against the declaration of martial law in Mindanao, the attack at the Resorts World Manila casino in Pasay City and US President Donald Trump for falsely calling the casino attack a 'terrorist attack'. They also called for the resumption of the peace talks between government and the National Democratic Front of the Philippines (NDFP).

A Marcos town Mayor and a municipal employee were shot dead by an unidentified assailant after inspecting a small impounding project in the municipality's Mabuti village in the morning of Saturday. (The motive of the attack and the identity of the killers is unclear.)

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on June 3 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. Government troops and civilian workers rescued 182 civilians on June 3 morning trapped in two separate areas in Marawi City but a militant sniper gunned down one of the civilians. According to government sources, the ongoing military operations left at least 178 people dead - 120 militants, 38 government security forces and 20 civilians. (3 fatalities have been recorded for June 3 but it is unclear when they occurred.)
A municipal mayor was hospitalized after a group of people beat him up for allegedly firing a gun in Maasin, Iloilo on June 3.

source: Front Line Defenders; ProtectDefenders.eu; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A leader of farmers' group Task Force Baha Talibayog (TFBT) was shot and killed by unidentified gunmen in 3 Jun 2017, in Calatagan town, Batangas province.

source: Channel News Asia; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on June 4 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. A 4-hour ceasefire 'humanitarian' ceasefire for relief and rescue efforts was declared on June 4 morning. As of June 6, according to government sources, the ongoing military operations left at least 193 people dead - 134 militants, 39 government security forces and 20 civilians. (14 fatalities have been equally divided for each day from Jun 4 to June 6.)

Four militants and a soldier were killed in a three-hour gunfight on June 4 in Barangay Tukanalipao in Mamasapano, Maguindanao. The 40th Infantry Battalion was patrolling in an open field when they were attacked by militant fighters. Government sources claimed that the militants belonged to Bangsomoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) who in turn denied their involvement and claimed that the attackers were from the Maute group or Abu Sayyaf. The militants allegedly had planned to take over the detachment and raise the Islamic State flag there to create an impression that there is presence of IS forces in Maguindanao.

The Philippine security forces continued their military operation on June 5 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. As of June 6, according to government sources, the ongoing military operations left at least 193 people dead - 134 militants, 39 government security forces and 20 civilians. (14 fatalities have been equally divided for each day from Jun 4 to June 6.)

High-school students and youth organizations, led by Anakbayan, Kabataan Party-list group and League of Filipino Students, staged a camp-out protest at the Department of Education (DepEd) office in Pasig City, Manila against tuition fee hikes.
An unidentified armed group ambushed soldiers of the 27th Infantry Battalion in Sarangani province on June 5. One soldier was wounded.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug surrenderee was shot dead by motorcycle-riding men in Barangay Dangan, Reina Mercedes, Isabela on June 5.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed in a raid (assumed police) in Barangay Santa Rosa Primera, Marilao town in Bulacan on June 5.
A drug surrenderee was shot dead by unidentified men along the provincial road in Barangay Pantay Fatima in Vigan City, Ilocos Sur on Monday on June 5.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed in a police raid in Barangay Dalampang, Cabanatuan town in Nueva Ecija on June 5.
A drug suspect was shot dead by motorcycle-riding men in front of his ukay-ukay store along the highway in Barangay Ugac Sur, Tuguegarao, Cagayan on June 6.

source: RMN Networks; Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Manila, Metro Manila on 06 Jun 2017.

A drug suspect was abducted and shot dead by unidentified armed men claiming to be police officers at Caloocan City, Metro Manila on 6 June 2017. The minor was killed after learning he is the son of a drug suspect killed a week earlier during a police operation.

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: Four drug suspects, including a police officer, were killed in a police raid in Barangay Bolboc, Batangas City on June 6, 2017. Victim assumed to be off-duty and unarmed at time of attack.

source: EFE; Journal (Philippines); Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A civilian was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified gunmen at Navotas, Metro Manila on 06 Jun 2017. The incident is being investigated if it is related to drugs.

A week-long power outage inside the Metro Manila District Jail at Camp Bagong Diwa in Taguig City led to rioting among inmates who demonstrated against the lack of electricity on June 6 night. Two inmates were killed while 17 were wounded.

Gunmen shot and killed a policeman, and wounded another police officer who came to his aid on Tuesday (June 6) at San Carlos City in Pangasinan province. (The motive of the attack and the identity of the killers is unclear.)

Parents, students and their supporters staged a rally in Tarlac on June 6 protesting the alleged excessive and illegal fees imposed by officials of Tarlac National High School (TNHS) and anomalous spending of their organization's fund. Tuesday was the third day of a series of mass actions by the protesters.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug surrenderee was shot dead by masked men in his house in Barangay San Jose, Plaridel, Bulacan.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was shot and killed by undercover agents (assumed police) in Barangay San Jose, Rodriguez town in Rizal on June 6.
A drug suspect was shot dead by motorcycle-riding men in Barangay Sta. Maria, Lal-lo area, Cagayan on June 6.

Arrests: The leader of the Maute Group, along with four other companions that include his daughter and second wife were arrested by security officials in a checkpoint at Sirawan, Toril in Davao City at around 10 am on June 6.

The Philippine security forces continued their military operation on June 6 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. As of June 6, according to government sources, the ongoing military operations left at least 193 people dead - 134 militants, 39 government security forces and 20 civilians. (14 fatalities have been equally divided for each day from Jun 4 to June 6.)
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Cordova, Cebu on 06 Jun 2017.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect found dead hogtied with his face wrapped in packing tape near a drainage in Barangay Buhang, Molo district, Jaro of Iloilo City on June 8 morning.

The Philippine security forces continued their military operation on June 7 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. As of June 8 night, according to government sources, the ongoing military operations left at least 198 people dead - 138 militants, 40 government security forces and 20 civilians. (5 fatalities have been divided for the days of Jun 7 to June 8.)

Bangsomoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) encountered troops of the Philippine Army's 601st Infantry Brigade in a 4-hours fire fight at Barangay Pusao, Shariff Saydona Mustapha in Maguindanao on June 7. Four BIFF members and six soldiers were allegedly killed.
A drug suspect was killed by suspected vigilantes in Barangay Centro 2, Sanchez Mira town in Cagayan on June 7.

New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas attacked the dam area of Lepanto Consolidated Mining Corp. (LCMC) at Cabatuan, Colalo, Mankayan, Benguet on June 7 night, burning the chemical and mineral laboratory owned by Xian Jinrui Lianliungang. The attack resulted in a fire fight between rebels and troopers from the Philippine Army's 54th Infantry Battalion that wounded a government soldier. The NPAs also detonated explosives destroying a newly constructed community police precinct, a backhoe owned by Barangay Chairman Ambino Padawi and a floating machine for processing copper owned by businessman Jian Lianlungang. A lime mixing plant and a bulldozer owned by Flores Construction were also blasted.

notes: A drug suspect, who was also associated with the Maute Group, was killed in a raid by the PDEA, police, and army in Barangay Jose Abad Santos, Malabang town in Lanao del Sur on June 7. His wife and three associates were arrested.
A drug suspect was killed during a raid (assumed police) in Barangay Tubectubang, Moncada town in Tarlac on June 7.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star

Supporters from the contractual' labour centre and the Liga ng Manggagawa para sa Regular na Hanapbuhay (Liga) held a protest and put up a temporary camp in front of the National Labor Relations Commission (NLRC) in Manila on June 8, opposing their employers' bid to get an approval from government agencies to end their ongoing strike without resolving the issues that caused it. The strikers are demanding regularization on their jobs under their rightful employers.
A drug suspect was killed by suspected vigilantes in sitio Patubig, Barangay Santa Ines, Plaridel town in Bulacan on June 8.

source: Philippine News Agency; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed by undercover police in Barangay Sagpon, Daraga town in Legazpi on June 8.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect and chairwoman was shot dead by unidentified men in Barangay 37A Caridad, Cavite City on June 8 afternoon.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was killed by anti-drug operatives (assumed police) in Barangay Wawa III in Cavite City on June 8.
A drug suspect was killed by undercover police in Barangay Batia, Bocaue town in Bulacan on June 8.

The Philippine security forces continued their military operation on June 8 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. As of June 8 night, according to government sources, the ongoing military operations left at least 198 people dead - 138 militants, 40 government security forces and 20 civilians. (5 fatalities have been divided for the days of Jun 7 to June 8.)

Four policemen were ambushed by alleged members of the New People's Army in the remote Sitio Salvacion, Barangay Biga of Giporlos town area, Eastern Samar, early on June 8. No one was hurt in the attack. Elements of the Eastern Samar Police Public Safety Company and the Regional Police Safety Management Battalion along with elements of the 14th Infantry Battalion of the Philippine Army have been hunting down the rebels.

A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at San Rafael, Bulacan on 08 Jun 2017.

source: Tempo; Foundation for Media Alternatives; ABS CBN

An unidentified drug suspect was killed by suspected vigilantes (assumed) in Mallig town in Isabela on June 9.
An unidentified drug suspect was killed by suspected vigilantes (assumed) in Ramon town in Isabela on June 9.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug surrenderee was shot dead and his companion was critically wounded by unidentified men in Bantug, Roxas, Isabela on June 9. The second victim later succumbed to his injuries.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug surrenderee was shot dead by unidentified men in Barangay Burgos Centro 1, Mallig area, Isabela on June 9, 2017.

The Philippine security forces resumed its airstrikes on June 9 dropping bombs on the areas of Lilod, Marinaut and Bangolo to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. A U.S. Navy aircraft provided surveillance for the local troops. In Friday's street-to-street gun battles 13 marines were killed and a 15-year-old boy was also killed by a stray bullet as he took part in Friday prayers at a mosque in Marawi. Some 40 marines were wounded in the gun battles that lasted 14 hours. The violence has left at least 217 people dead - 138 militants, 58 government security forces and 21 civilians. (19 fatalities are recorded for June 9.)

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives; Bombo Radyo
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified gunmen at Tuguegarao, Cagayan on 09 Jun 2017.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives; Ronda Balita
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified gunmen at Manila, Metro Manila on 10 Jun 2017.

The Philippine security forces continued their military operation on June 10 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. According to government sources, the ongoing military operations left at least 270 people dead - 191 militants, 58 government security forces and 21 civilians. (53 fatalities have been divided for the days of Jun 10 to June 11.)

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star

notes: A drug suspect was killed by suspected vigilantes in Tumauini City area in Isabela on June 10.

A police contingent taking four suspected Maute members to Cagayan de Oro City was ambushed by armed men (assumed to be Maute members) in Pantar area, Lanao del Norte, on June 10 evening. At least four police officers were confirmed wounded and were brought to a hospital. At least 4 Maute Group members were reportedly killed and a few policemen injured in the attack.

A former vice governor of Abra province was shot dead and his two companions were wounded by a masked gunman outside a cockpit arena in Marikina City in the early hours of June 10. The motive behind the attack remained under investigation.
Balete Mayor was gunned down by unidentified assailant in Balete town, Batangas on June 10 morning. (The motive of the attack is unclear.)

The head of the police intelligence unit in Alaminos town area in Laguna province was killed in an attack by former soldiers on June 11 afternoon at Barangay (village) Poblacion 1. (The motive of the attack is unclear.)

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: Two drug suspects were found dead at the hands of suspected vigilantes in front of his house in Barangay Salvador, Santiago City area, Isabela on June 11, 2017.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead by suspected vigilantes in front of his house in Barangay Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela on June 11.

The police encountered former soldiers who were fleeing after killing the head of the police intelligence unit in Alaminos town area in Laguna province on June 11 at Barangay San Andres. The encounter resulted in the wounding and the arrest of two of the three suspects .

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead by suspected vigilantes in San Juan, Cordon, Isabela on June 11.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star

The Philippine security forces continued their military operation on June 11 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. According to government sources, the ongoing military operations left at least 270 people dead - 191 militants, 58 government security forces and 21 civilians. (53 fatalities have been divided for the days of Jun 10 to June 11.)
A drug suspect was wounded in an attack by suspected vigilantes in in Reina Mercedes town, Isabela on June 11.

source: ABS CBN; Bombo Radyo; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified gunmen at Libon, Albay on 11 Jun 2017.

Troops from the army's 16th Infantry Battalion clashed with New People's Army guerrillas at Sitio Bajada, Paradise Embac village, in Paquibato district in Davao on June 11 morning. The encounter left two government soldiers dead and six wounded. The body of a 17-year-old alleged communist guerrilla was also recovered.
New People's Army (NPA) attacked an army detachment of the 25th Infantry Battalion at Barangay Rizal, Monkayo area, Davao de Oro province on June 12.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead by suspected vigilantes at an eatery on GSIS Road corner Ortigas Avenue Extension in Barangay Rosario, Pasig on June 12.

About 300 members of Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan) and Anakbayan took out an Independence Day protest march from A.C. Cortes Avenue in Mandaue City to Mactan-Benito Ebuen Air Base in Lapu-Lapu City in Cebu province on June 12, against the declaration of martial law in Mindanao.

Akbayan party held an Independence Day protest at Plaza Miranda, Manila on June 12. Hundreds of students and members of various organizations showed up at an interfaith prayer rally, appealing to the government to lift martial law in Mindanao, pursue peace talks, and reinforce human rights amid extrajudicial killings in the country.
A drug suspect was shot and killed by operatives (assumed police) in Barangay Apulit, Paniqui town in Tarlac on June 12.

Non-violent activity: Four members of the paramilitary group Alamara forcefully entered the Salugpongan Ta Tanu Igkanogon Community Learning Centre in Sitio Nasilaban, Talaingod area, Davao del Norte on June 12 and harassed the teacher-in charge, suspecting him to be a rebel sympathizer.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead by suspected vigilantes at Sitio 1, Barangay San Jose, Mandaluyong around 7 p.m. on June 12.
Protesters staged an Independence Day candle-lighting protest at Roxas City plaza bandstand in Capiz province on June 12, against the declaration of martial law in Mindanao.

source: Channel News Asia; AFP; Philippine Daily Inquirer; AP
notes: The Philippine security forces started conducting more airstrikes at 2 am on June 12 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. Amidst fighting, the Philippine flag was raised in Marawi to celebrate Independence Day. Five civilians were killed on Monday while trying to escape the fighting. IS also released a video on Monday via its Amaq propaganda news agency which it said showed jihadists shooting six Christians in Marawi. According to government sources, the ongoing military operations left at least 286 people dead - 202 militants, 58 government security forces and 26 civilians. (16 fatalities are recorded for June 12.)

About 300 members of Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan) and Anakbayan took out an Independence Day protest march from A.C. Cortes Avenue in Mandaue City to Mactan-Benito Ebuen Air Base in Lapu-Lapu City in Cebu province on June 12, against the declaration of martial law in Mindanao.
About 200 protesters, led by Bayan, staged an Independence Day protest at Plazoletagay intersection in Iloilo City, Iloilo on June 12, against the declaration of martial law in Mindanao.
Protesters staged an Independence Day candle-lighting protest at Pastrana Park in the capital town of Kalibo in Aklan province on June 12, against the declaration of martial law in Mindanao.

Activists, led by Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan), staged an anti-China protest at Makati City, Manila on Independence Day on June 12. They called for an end to China's aggressiveness in the disputed waters, demanding that it respect Philippine sovereignty.

The leftist group Bayan staged a demonstration outside the United States embassy in Manila on June 12, as the country celebrated its 119th Independence Day, to denounced what they described as US 'intervention' in the Philippines' affairs. Some activists clashed with the police.
A drug suspect was shot and killed in an ambush by another drug suspect in Barangay Patong, Magsingal town in Ilocos Sur on June 12.
At least 300 people took out an Independence Day protest march from Sto. Rosario Church to Metro Colon in downtown Cebu City, Cebu on June 12, against the declaration of martial law in Mindanao.

The Philippine security forces continued their military operation on June 13 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. Five of 70 Philippine police officers reported missing and five civilians being held captive by militants were rescued on Tuesday. According to government sources, the ongoing military operations left at least 290 people dead - 206 militants, 58 government security forces and 26 civilians. (4 fatalities are recorded for June 13.)
A village councilor was shot dead by unidentified men in Gubat town in Sorsogon province on June 13 evening. He survived the attack. The motive behind the attack remained under investigation.

The Philippine security forces continued their military operation on June 15 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. Three civilians were rescued on Friday by a joint government-Moro Islamic Liberation Front team through the 'peace corridor' project of the Office of the Presidential Assistant on the Peace Process (Opapp). According to government sources, as of June 17 the ongoing military operations left at least 310 people dead - 225 militants, 59 government security forces and 26 civilians. (21 fatalities have been divided for the days of Jun 15 to June 17.)

notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified gunmen at Quezon City, Metro Manila on 16 Jun 2017.

A drug suspect was shot dead by suspected vigilantes at Begia village of Cawayan town area, Masbate province at about 5:30 am June 16.

The Philippine security forces continued their military operation on June 16 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. Government troops on Thursday advanced toward the centre of Marawi and gained control of key bridges in the city after street-to-street fighting in recent days. An Australian television journalist was shot in the neck on Thursday, but he did not suffer major injuries. According to government sources, as of June 17 the ongoing military operations left at least 310 people dead - 225 militants, 59 government security forces and 26 civilians. (21 fatalities have been divided for the days of Jun 15 to June 17.)

16 June. Government forces conducted an air strike and artillery fire on an Abu Sayyaf camp in Ungkaya Pukan town area, Bailian on June 16 leading to the rescued a Vietnamese sailor in Basilan who was captured by Abu Sayyaf militants in November 2016. No ASG casualties have been confirmed.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Guimba, Nueva Ecija on 16 Jun 2017.
A drug suspect was shot dead by suspected vigilantes in Bat-organ village in Mandaon town area, Masbate province at about 5:30 am June 16.
Youth activists staged a protest rally in Manila on June 16, 2017, calling for an end to martial law in Mindanao.
A drug suspect was wounded in a gun attack by suspected vigilantes in her house in Barangay Holy Spirit in Quezon City on June 16.
Two drug suspects were shot dead by suspected vigilantes near a vulcanizing shop on Visayas Avenue corner Bicol Street in Quezon City on June 16.

Members of the urban poor group Kalipunan ng Damayang Mahihirap (Kadamay) staged a protest outside the National Housing Authority (NHA) headquarters in Quezon City, Manila on June 16, demanding distribution of the idle homes to the urban poor.
A drug suspect was shot dead by suspected vigilantes at Buenavista village of Uson town area, Masbate province at about 5:30 am June 17.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on June 17 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. On Saturday, 400 fresh troops were airlifted to Marawi from the central Philippines. According to government sources, as of June 17 the ongoing military operations left at least 310 people dead - 225 militants, 59 government security forces and 26 civilians. (21 fatalities have been divided for the days of Jun 15 to June 17.)
Two suspected communist rebels were killed in a clash with government troops in Araibo village area in Pantukan town area in Davao de Oro on June 17.

18 June. Government forces, backed by a barrage of artillery fire, captured an Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) encampment on June 18 in a hinterland village in the restive province (Ungkaya Pukan town area) of Basilan in southern Philippines. The military said it killed an undetermined number of militants before taking their camp but troops had not recovered a single body of a slain Abu Sayyaf fighter. (unknown fatalities coded as 3)
A drug suspect was shot dead by suspected vigilantes in Cabitan village in Mandaon town area, Masbate province at about 5:30 am June 18.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives

About 50 communist rebels stormed a police station in the central town of Maasin in Iloilo province on Nune 18 noon and seized 12 rifles and pistols, two-way radios, laptop computers, jewellery and a patrol car. No casualties were reported. The attack was allegedly a retribution against the police for its corruption.

Two Army soldiers were wounded in an ambush staged by suspected New People's Army (NPA) rebels at Barangay (village) Ajos in nearby Catanauan town area in Quezon province Bondoc Peninsula area on June 18 evening. The rebels allegedly also sustained casualties.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on June 18 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. According to government sources, as of June 20 the ongoing military operations left at least 349 people dead - 258 militants, 65 government security forces and 26 civilians. (39 fatalities have been divided for the days of Jun 18 to June 20.)
Property destruction: At least 10 members of the New People's Army (NPA) reportedly torched two power generator sets of a Globe cell site in Barangay Tuhian, in Catanauan town area on June 18 night.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was killed by undercover agents (assumed police) in Barangay Tallunga, Reina Mercedes town in Isabela on June 18.

Soldiers from the 28th Infantry Battalion clashed with communist insurgents from the New People's Army (NPA) on June 18 and killed a still undetermined number of rebel gunmen in the village of Kauswagan, Mati City area in the southern Mindanao province of Davao Oriental. There were no casualties from the government side. (unknown fatalities)

According to government sources, as of June 20 the ongoing military operations left at least 349 people dead - 258 militants, 65 government security forces and 26 civilians. Around 1,000 members joined the caravan.

Hundreds of residents from the historic town of Balangiga staged a protest in front of the offices of the National Housing Authority (NHA) in Tacloban, Leyte to express their dismay over the quality of houses being built for the survivors of Super typhoon Yolanda.

The gunfire claimed no lives or injuries.

notes: A drug suspect who was also a PDEA agent was killed by undercover police in Barangay San Juan, Sibalom town in Antique on June 20. Victim assumed to be off-duty and unarmed at time of attack.

Arrests: Military and police personnel staged a raid at Barangay Bangkal in Patikul town area, Sulu on June 20, leading to the arrest of 29 suspected members of the Abu Sayyaf group. No fire fight occurred as the suspects did not resist arrest.

A retired Philippine Marine was killed after being ambushed by motorcycle-riding men along Bonifacio Avenue in Intramuros, Manila on June 20. The motive behind the attack remained under investigation.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on June 20 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. Fighting was intense early on Tuesday as security forces made a push to drive the militants, entrenched in Marawi's commercial district, south towards a lake on the edge of the city. According to government sources, as of June 20 the ongoing military operations left at least 349 people dead - 258 militants, 65 government security forces and 26 civilians. (39 fatalities have been divided for the days of Jun 18 to June 20.)
Three suspected New People's Army (NPA) shot dead a retired soldier at Barangay Lumapao, Canlaon City area, Negros Oriental June 20 morning.

Four soldiers belonging to the 20th Infantry Battalion were wounded in an ambush by alleged members of the New People's Army (NPA) on June 20 night along the national highway between Barangays (village) Somage and Polangi in Catarman area in Northern Samar. An exchange of gunfire ensued between the soldiers and the about 30 rebels.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was shot dead by suspected vigilantes in Barangay Sta. Cruz in Guiguinto area, Bulacan town at around 4:30 p.m. on June 20.

A soldier from the Ninth Infantry Division was killed and four others were wounded during a fire fight between government troops and members of the New People's Army in Camarines Norte. The clash erupted after the rebels lobbed a hand grenade into a military detachment at Barangay Dumagmang, Labo area.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Barangay Peacekeeping Action Team
notes: 200 gunmen, led by five commanders of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF), attacked the outpost of the Barangay Peacekeeping Action Team (BPAT) at the farming village Malagakit in Pigcawayan area, North Cotabato, at around 5 am on June 21, triggering a fire fight. The militants withdraw and occupied a school holding held 31 people hostage as human shields. The militants were able to escape at night, while leaving their 31 hostages unharmed. At least eight people (a militiaman, a local farmer and six BIFF rebels) have been killed in the clashes, according to Philippine military officials on Thursday.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed by undercover police in Barangay Caingin, Plaridel town in Bulacan on June 20 or 21.

notes: Gunmen, led by five commanders of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF), laid siege to the farming village Simsiman in Pigcawayan area, North Cotabato on June 21, provoking a running gunfight with volunteer community watchmen and local militiamen.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on June 21 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. Snipers were still firing from 'strategic nests' in schools and mosques, and homemade bombs were hampering the progress of his troops as they advanced house to house. According to government sources, as of June 21 the ongoing military operations left at least 360 people dead - 268 militants, 66 government security forces and 26 civilians. (11 fatalities are recorded for June 21.)

Locals staged a peace caravan in Mansalay town, Oriental Mindoro, Mimaropa, on June 21, 2017, demanding that the government and National Democratic Front of the Philippines (NDFP) resume peace negotiations.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a raid (assumed police) in Barangay District 10, Balayan City in Batangas on June 21.

Property destruction: The Philippine military allegedly razed nine houses of farmers and Lumad to the ground at Sitio 56, Barangay Rizal, Monkayo area in Davao de Oro (assumed around June 22) as part of a retaliation campaign against the New People's Army (NPA) following attacks on army detachments in the area.
New People's Army (NPA) attacked an army scout platoon of the 72nd Infantry Battalion at Sitio Dipo, Barangay Upper Ulip, Monkayo area, Davao de Oro province on June 22.

New People's Army (NPA) rebels assassinated sugarcane planter Norberto Lumayno and his driver in an ambush on June 22 at Barangay Minapasok in Calatrava town, Negros Occidental, accusing Lumayno of grabbing land and intimidating farmers. The NPA later has admitted to the killing.
Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Navotas, Metro Manila on 22 Jun 2017.

The Philippine military allegedly aerial bombing six times in nearby communities in Monkayo area in Davao de Oro for two days (assumed on June 22 and 23), following attacks of the New People's Army (NPA) on army detachments in the area.

Government forces encountered New People's Army (NPA) rebels at Barangay Cambayobo in Calatrava area on June 22, when soldiers of the 62nd Infantry Battalion pursued fleeing rebels after an ambush-slay of two civilians at Barangay Minapasok of Calatrava town.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star

A drug suspect and suspected victim of summary execution was found along Hulo street in Barangay Bagbaguin, Meycauayan, Bulacan. The head and arm of the victim was covered with packing tape.
A village chief was ambushed and shot along Roxas Boulevard in Manila on June 22 by men on a motorcycle. He survived the attack. The motive behind the attack remained under investigation.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on June 22 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. According to government sources, as of June 22 the ongoing military operations left at least 369 people dead - 276 militants, 67 government security forces and 26 civilians. (9 fatalities are recorded for June 22.)

Progressive groups held another Black Friday protest on June 23 at Plaza Miranda in Manila and marched to Mendiola, to protest the declaration of martial law in Mindanao and continued military intervention by the United States (US), which has provided technical support to the Armed Forces of the Philippines in Marawi City.

Activists staged a protest outside the central office of the Commission for Human Rights (CHR Region XI) in Davao City, Davao del Sur (assumed on June 23), to urged President Rodrigo Duterte to lift Martial because of the alarming increase of abuses in Mindanao.

An undetermined number of communist guerrillas attacked the patrol base of the Davao del Norte provincial public safety company (DNPPSC) in Barangay (village) Malitbog in Panabo City area, Davao del Norte on June 23 morning. Four people (3 rebels and 1 policeman) were killed. A joint police-army team conducting pursuit operations killed the three rebels.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on June 23 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. According to government sources, as of June 23 the ongoing military operations left at least 375 people dead - 280 militants, 69 government security forces and 26 civilians. (6 fatalities are recorded for June 23.)

An unidentified assailant on a motorbike threw a grenade at a police community precinct at the Manila Police District (MPD) before dawn on June 23. Gunshots were also heard following the incident. No one was hurt.

The Philippine security declared an 8-hour ceasefire in Marawi City on June 25 allowing residents to celebrate the end of Ramadan. Six civilians including an elderly were rescued during the humanitarian pause. Sunday afternoon the hostilities between the government forces and a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force continued. Australia has sent two high-tech surveillance planes to help Filipino troops in Marawi, joining the United States in providing military assistance. According to government sources, as of June 25 the ongoing military operations left at least 387 people dead - 290 militants, 70 government security forces and 27 civilians. (12 fatalities have been divided for the days of Jun 24 to June 25.)

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star

Militant students and faculty members of the University of the Philippines(UP) in Diliman, Quezon City, Manila held a traditional lightning protest on June 25, calling for the lifting of martial law in Mindanao.

New People's Army (NPA) rebels ambushed the convoy of Cagayan Valley province police director on June 26 at Barangay San Carlos, Gattaran town area. It is not clear if people were hurt in the incident.

At least 15 to 20 armed men, believed to be members of the New People's Army, attempted to attack the base of 2nd Maneuver Provincial Public Safety Company in Barangay Taugtog, Botolan area, Zambales at about 1 am on June 26. Members of the Philippine National Police (PNP) repulsed the militants, resulting in a brief exchange of fire. The suspected rebels retreated to the mountains with government forces in pursuit. There was no casualty on the side of the PNP.

Teachers and schoolchildren staged a protest at the Department of Justice in Davao City, Davao del Sur on June 29, against continued harassment by a member of the Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit and the 60th and 72nd Infantry Battalion of the Armed Forces of the Philippines.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on June 29 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. According to government sources, as of June 30 the ongoing military operations left at least 438 people dead - 317 militants, 82 government security forces and 39 civilians. Government revised down an earlier toll of 44 for civilians killed. (24 fatalities have been divided for the days of Jun 29 and June 30.)

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Marilao town, Bulacan on June 28 or 29.

Government forces clashed with New People's Army (NPA) rebels at Sitio Agpapatao, Barangay Sandayao, Guihulngan City area in Negros Oriental on June 29 night, after soldiers of the 79th Infantry Battalion (IB) responded to an information relayed to them by residents in the area about the presence of about 30 rebels, who were recruiting new members.
A drug suspect was killed by operatives (assumed police) in Barangay Malabanias, Angeles City in Pampanga on June 28 or 29.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed by undercover police in San Rafael town, Bulacan on June 28 or 29.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Manila Bulletin
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid within Malolos City, Marilao, San Rafael, or Norzagaray areas (assumed Malolos city with GP 2) in Bulacan province on June 28 or 29 2017.

source: Journal (Philippines); Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Caloocan, Metro Manila on 30 Jun 2017. The suspect was killed by his/her own grenade during the buy bust operation.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed by suspected vigilantes in Barangay Hulo, Mandaluyong City in Metro Manila on June 30.

assoc_actor_1: Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan); Students (Philippines); Teachers (Philippines); Health Workers (Philippines)
notes: Some 500 people joined the peaceful protest march ome 500 people joined the peaceful protest march in Manila on June 30, to show their dissatisfaction with President Rodrigo Duterte, who assumed that office one year ago. The main organizers of the action were the leftist Bayan alliance and feminist Gabriela organization, with several other groups participating including the League of Filipino Students and teacher and health associations.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on June 30 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. The United States allegedly help training Philippine soldiers in urban warfare. According to government sources, as of June 30 the ongoing military operations left at least 438 people dead - 317 militants, 82 government security forces and 39 civilians. Government revised down an earlier toll of 44 for civilians killed. (24 fatalities have been divided for the days of Jun 29 and June 30.)

Teachers and schoolchildren staged a protest outside the AFP's headquarters in Panacan, Davao City, Davao del Sur on June 30, against continued harassment by a member of the Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit and the 60th and 72nd Infantry Battalion of the Armed Forces of the Philippines.

Labour groups - Sentro ng mga Nagkakaisa at Progresibong Manggagawa (Sentro), Partido Manggagawa (PM), Federation of Free Workers (FFW), National Federation of Labor Unions (Naflu), and the Philippine Airlines Employees Association (Palea) - staged a protest at the Boy Scout Circle in Quezon City, Manila on June 30, to show their dissatisfaction with President Rodrigo Duterte, who assumed that office one year ago.
